info.title: Transformerlab API
info.summary: An API for working with LLMs.
info.description: Transformerlab API helps you do awesome stuff. 🚀

get.summary: Returns the grouped model gallery from model-group-gallery.json.

get.summary: Given a model ID, upload it to Hugging Face.
get.description: Given a model ID, upload it to Hugging Face.

Takes a specific model string that must match huggingface ID to download
This function will not be able to infer out description etc of the model
since it is not in the gallery
Download a specific GGUF file from a GGUF repository

Provide a reference to a model in the gallery, and we will download it
from huggingface

You can manually specify a pre-created job_id if you want to track the progress of the download with
a defined job_id provided by the API using /job/createId

try to import a file into TransformerLab.

Returns:
    JSON response with status and pipeline tag data

Download API logs as a zip file containing:
- local_server.log (from HOME_DIR)
- transformerlab.log (from workspace_dir)

Returns a zip file with available log files. If no files exist, returns an error.

delete.description:
Delete an audio file associated with a specific experiment.

This endpoint deletes an audio file from the experiment's audio directory.
You must pass the metadata ID of the audio file (not the actual filename) as the `filename` parameter.

Args:
    experimentId (int): The ID of the experiment.
    filename (str): The metadata ID of the audio file (e.g. 2c164641-c4ce-4fb8-bc7f-0d32cab81249) to delete (not the full wav filename).

Returns:
    dict: A message indicating the result of the deletion operation.

Responses:
    200:
        description: Audio file deleted successfully.
        content:
            application/json:
                example:
                    {"message": "Audio file <filename> deleted from experiment <experimentId>"}
    404:
        description: Experiment or audio file does not exist.
        content:
            application/json:
                example:
                    {"message": "Experiment <experimentId> does not exist"}
                    {"message": "Audio file <filename> does not exist in experiment <experimentId>"}

get.description:
plugin_name: the id of the exporter plugin to run
plugin_architecture: A string containing the standard name of plugin architecture
plugin_params: a string of JSON containing parameters for this plugin (found in plugins info.json)
job_id: optional job_id to use instead of creating a new job (for use by job system)

post.description:
Add an evaluation to an experiment. This will create a new directory in the experiment
and add global plugin to the specific experiment. By copying the plugin to the experiment
directory, we can modify the plugin code for the specific experiment without affecting
other experiments that use the same plugin.

get.description:
Delete an evaluation from an experiment. This will delete the directory in the experiment
and remove the global plugin from the specific experiment.

post.description: Get the contents of the evaluation

get.description: Get the output of an evaluation

post.description:
Add an generationn to an experiment. This will create a new directory in the experiment
and add global plugin to the specific experiment. By copying the plugin to the experiment
directory, we can modify the plugin code for the specific experiment without affecting
other experiments that use the same plugin.

get.description:
Delete an generation from an experiment. This will delete the directory in the experiment
and remove the global plugin from the specific experiment.

post.description: Get the contents of the generation

get.description: Get the output of an generation

get.description:
Cancel a running workflow by stopping all its current jobs.
The workflow execution engine will automatically detect the stopped jobs
and transition the workflow to CANCELLED status.

get.description:
Get paginated history of generated images

Args:
    experimentId: The experiment ID to get history for
    limit: Maximum number of items to return (default 50)
    offset: Number of items to skip (default 0)

Returns:
    HistoryResponse with list of images and total count

delete.description: Clear all image generation history and remove all image files

get.summary: Get the actual image by ID
get.description:
Get an image from history by ID and index

Args:
    image_id: The unique ID of the image set
    index: The index of the image in the set (default 0)
    input_image: Whether to return the input image instead of generated image
    mask_image: Whether to return the mask image instead of generated image

delete.description:
Delete a specific image set from history and remove the image files

Args:
    experimentId: The experiment ID
    image_id: The unique ID of the image set to delete

get.description:
Get metadata for a specific image set by its ID

Args:

Returns:

get.summary: Get image count for an image set
get.description:
Get the number of images available for a given image_id

Args:

Returns:

get.summary: Get all images for an image set as a zip file

Get all images for a given image_id as a zip file

Returns:

Create a dataset from selected images in history

put.description: Update team name. Only team owners can update the team.

delete.description: Delete a team. Only team owners can delete the team.

get.description: Get all members of a team. Any team member can view this.

post.description:
Create a team invitation. Only team owners can invite members.

This creates a pending invitation that the user must accept by clicking
the verification link sent to their email.

Returns a shareable invitation URL and email delivery status.

delete.description: Remove a member from the team. Only team owners can remove members.

put.description: Update a member's role. Only team owners can change roles.

get.description:
Get all pending invitations for the current user.

Returns a list of pending team invitations created for the user's email address.
Users can accept these invitations to join teams.

post.description:
Accept a team invitation using the invitation token.

The user must be authenticated and the invitation must match their email address.
Token is obtained from the invitation URL shared by the team owner.

Reject a team invitation.

The user must be authenticated and the invitation must match their email address.

get.description:
Get all invitations for a team (pending, accepted, rejected, expired).

Only team owners can view this. Useful for tracking who has been invited
and the status of each invitation.

delete.description: Cancel a pending invitation. Only team owners can cancel invitations.

post.description:
Upload a single file for a provider-backed task.

The file is stored under workspace_dir/uploads/tasks/{task_id}/ and the
stored_path returned from this endpoint can be used as the local side of a
file mount mapping: {<remote_path>: <stored_path>}.

get.description:
List all providers for the current team.
Requires X-Team-Id header and team membership.

post.description:

Returns whether Google OAuth is configured and available.
Frontend can use this to show/hide the Google login button.
The response varies based on the authentication backend used.
The response varies based on the authentication backend used.

post.description:
Takes a long-lived refresh token, validates it, and returns a new short-lived access token.
AND rotates the refresh token (returns a new one) to keep the session alive indefinitely.
